result.execSummary:
The defendant Uruba Lumpkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNTS 2 and 3, with Huber if working. If not working, release to the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

*Restitution set at $0*

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school. If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job.
Obtain GED or HSED.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Lena's Food Market located at 2322 W. Oak Street.

Cooperate with agent.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: COUNTS 1 and 3, with Huber if working. If not working, release to the Day Reporting Center.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation on COUNTS 1 and 2; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Uruba Lumpkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charges and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements by State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNTS 2 and 3, with Huber release privileges if working.  If not working, release to the Day Reporting Center.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
--Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Lena's Food Market located at 2322 W. Oak Street
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNTS 1 and 3, with Huber release privileges if working.  If not working, release to the Day Reporting Center.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
--Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Lena's Food Market located at 2322 W. Oak Street
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of 7 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 54 days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation on COUNTS 1 and 2; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information amending charge as follows:  COUNT 1:  Theft, Use of a Dangerous Weapon pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 943.20(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor; COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, Use of a Dangerous Weapon pursuant to Wisc. Stats 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor; COUNT 3:  Carrying a Concealed Weapon pursuant to Wis. Stats. 941.232), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Defendant waives reading of the Amended Information and enters a Not Guilty plea.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties requests another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel came into court requesting an adjournment of the 06/26/2015 final pretrial because the investigator needs more time. The State does not object. Matter set for final pre-trial on 07/10/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests a Speedy Trial.  Matter set for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, Defendant Uruba Lumpkins not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced fromt he House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Corianna Chisum-MPD Milwaukee.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Promise M. or Lena's Food Market at 2322 W Oak Street, Milwaukee

Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Uruba Lumpkins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
